title.narrative: Enhancing Public Health Capacity for the Safe Resumption of International Travel in Viet Nam

description.narrative: The overall objective of the proposed project is to contribute to enhancing public health capacity at points of entry (POE) for the safe resumption of international travel in Viet Nam. First, the frontline officials at POE and health-care providers at designated facilities will be equipped with the necessary personal protective equipment and other essential supplies that are identified in the needs assessment, to safely receive international travelers coming in and departing from Viet Nam, while effectively preventing transmission of COVID-19. Secondly, to ensure that coherent guidelines are applied and followed for the reopening of the borders and resumption of international travels, consultative workshops with the key relevant authorities on public health and border control will be organized to develop a national guideline on the resumption of international travels with public health measures, and its effective nation-wide application will be facilitated through training-of-trainers and roll out trainings to frontline officials at POE. Finally, while the Prime Minister-led National Steering Committee for COVID-19 Prevention and Control has been quite efficient in securing and rolling out COVID-19 vaccination, in more remote border areas with illiterate and less educated populations (often ethnic minorities), gaps were observed in their understanding of vaccine’s risks and benefits, and the use of vaccine certificate. The project will organize community outreach communication events to raise their awareness on COVID-19 vaccine and to inform them about how to use vaccination certificate for domestic movements and international travels.
